sentences: Jäta jama, sa ju üksi ei jaksa!
Küll võib inimesele jama pähe tulla.
Seda filmi ei tasu vaadata, halearmas jama.
context: In Estonian, 'jama' is a versatile word that can refer to either senseless talk or gossip (rumalus, totrus) as well as to trouble, confusion, or complications (segeldus, tüli). It describes something that is worthless, empty, or causes problems. The word can be used to dismiss nonsense ('ära aja jama suust välja' - don't talk nonsense from your mouth) or to express frustration about difficulties and annoyances in life.
